subdivision_of_building:
Ground Floor side extension
Existing garage
description: Erection of a two storey end-terrace house with associated car parking and landscaping following the demolition of the existing side extension and existing garage
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [iDesign and access statement, unnumbered location plan, LaVaastu/2023/343/03, LaVaastu/2023/343/04

Received: 14/07/2023

Energy statement for planning Received: 6/11/2023

LaVaastu/2023/343/05/REV A, LaVaastu/2023/343/06/REV A, LaVaastu/2023/343/02/REV C, Fire statement REV A

Received: 24/11/2023

Transport technical note 
Received: 30/11/2023].
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby approved shall match those used in the existing building at 1 Harvest Road, TW13 7JH.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Prior to any demolition and construction work, neighbours shall be given details outlining construction timeframes (including when demolition and piling will take place).

Condition : 5 - The first floor bathroom formed in the front and rear elevation as shown on drawing number LaVaastu/2023/343/05/REV A Received: 24/11/2023, of the hereby approved development shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the hereby approved development or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the approved development evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 8 - (A) No development above ground level shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority which demonstrate that:

(i)	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
(ii)	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
(iii)	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which would release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

(B) The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the local planning authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details under Part A of this condition. The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details at all times thereafter.

Condition : 9 - A. No development shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council that will secure a suitable contribution to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved. 

B. Prior to first occupation within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 10 - Either side of the vehicle access hereby approved, visibility splay areas (the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, with a splay of at least 2.4 metres x 2.4 metres) shall be provided before dwelling hereby approved and the access and parking area are brought into use and first occupied.  These areas shall be kept clear of any obstructions to visibility greater than 600 mm in height, including shrubs, planting, boundary walls, fences, gates, other means of enclosure or other structures or objects at all times.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding any details included in the submitted plans, prior to above ground works, details of landscape works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include: 
(a) means of enclosure/boundary treatments 
(b) other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas;
(c) hard surfacing materials
The development shall not be occupied until the details, as approved, have been implemented in full.

Condition : 12 - Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved development the waste and recycling store shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development

Condition : 13 - The dwelling hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the parking area and the access to it have been provided in accordance with the approved plans. This provision shall be permanently available for the occupiers and users of the dwellings, as annotated on the plans, and used for no other purpose.
